body.p:
Colesburg Jan 8th 1864
To His Excelency
Governor Bramblet

I sent you a Communication a few days Since in which I asked permition to recruit a Company of men for the protection of Hardin County and Surounding Country to the Statione at Elizabethtown I will further State that I will recruit the men from the discharged Soldiers that are not Subject to the draft. and we will furnish our own arms if we can git Henry rifles the discharge Soldiers are urging me and the Guerillas are murdering all the Soldiers they can find

I am very respcty
Your Obdt Servant
John F Lay

Colesburg Ky
Jany 8" 1865
Lay John F.
To the Gov.
Desires permission to raise a Co. for protection of Hardin & adjoining counties, The men will furnish their own arms --

L B No 9 -- 1865 P 141
Recd A. G. O. Ky 9 Jany 1865
